programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Prepare for pure decadence! Kirsten stuns with showstopping choux buns, nut-filled caramel wheels, and citrus-infused chocolate crackles. Along the way, she reveals her top tips and tricks for mastering chocolate like a pro.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: This episode is packed with irresistible treats! Kirsten unveils the secrets to a perfect sponge cake and whips up baked apples, buttery fudge shortbreads, and creamy maritozzi buns that are simply too good to miss.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey head to Seoul, home to one of the most popular and on trend cuisines in the world. - After meeting the Kiwi Ambassador, Karena and Kasey are taken out to try traditional Korean BBQ and a sing along with a Korean, Kiwi twist. - The sisters then split up—one heads to the hills and has a lesson with a kimchi Master, while the other eats her way around the famous Gwangjang Market. - At the end of the week they showcase Kiwi-Korean fusion cuisine to an elite group of foodies.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey are in the beautiful city of Rome and are on a learning curve about how to eat like a Roman. From Pasta Masters to finding out all about making traditional Italian dishes to being hand fed tripe, Rome is a city of discovery. - But it’s not all about the food as they head to Monte Cassino to visit the graves and battle-grounds where their whakapapa fought, as well as pay respect to where hundreds of other Kiwis lost their lives. - At the end of the week Karena and Kasey are tasked with cooking a three-course dinner for the Ambassador and a group of VIP guests, but have they bitten of more than they can chew?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today’s Come Dine With Me Professionals heads to Devon and first up are Stepmum and Stepson Zoe and Don from Honky Tonk who offer up their unique brand of wine and dine

programme.title: Asia Unplated
programme.desc: The celebration of Cantonese cooking begins in one of Melbourne’s most iconic restaurants, Flower Drum, in the heart of Chinatown. MasterChef alumni and friend, Karlie Verkerk, shares her recipe Yum Cha favourite dessert, ‘Mango Pudding’. For the main course, Diana creates ‘Pak Cham Kai’ by poaching a whole chicken in a pot with aromatics and topping with infused oil – Cantonese home cooking, simple yet delicious.

programme.title: Asia Unplated
programme.desc: Singaporean cuisine is widely influenced by several ethnic groups that make up the population. MasterChef winner Sashi Cheliah, raised in Singapore, shares his ‘Quick & easy Briyani’ which has a distinct Indian flair. Next is the famous ‘Fish Head Curry’, which has mixed Indian and Chinese influences. Finaly, Diana cooks one of her favourite ‘Hokkien Mee’, a simple noodle dish created using a homemade prawn stock.

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Anna and Kristina wrestle the 10th edition of this monster cookbook of over 2,000 recipes written by NY Times foodie, Mark Bittman. Will their lemon meringue pie impress their celebrity chef?

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Anna and Kristina test drive Guy Fieri’s cookbook of greasy-spoon eats based on his hit TV show. And guest judge - skating champ Brian Boitano – is as tough a critic as any figure skating judge.

programme.title: Cook Like An Italian
programme.desc: In this episode Silvia shares a few new tricks and hacks that Italians have learned to embrace. From a one Pot Tuna Pasta method even Silvia thought was too good to be true, to a no-knead method of baking sensational bread and finally the easiest pasta dish Silvia has ever made.

programme.title: Cook Like An Italian
programme.sub-title: The Glorious Food of Emilia Romagna
programme.desc: We return for Series Two with Silvia’s kitchen nearing the end of a renovation with Silvia cooking up a memorable lunch for the tradies and then christening the kitchen by cooking her beloved Nona’s Ragu.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: Host Noah Cappe welcomes four home cooks to the Wall of Chefs kitchen to do battle in front of a Wall of 12 culinary superstars.

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson loves cheese bread. She bakes up three different and delicious styles proving cheese and bread are a match made in heaven.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Saskatchewan produces the second most honey in Canada. Jenn learns about bees, how to make mead from honey and how honey can be used to elevate a dish.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Exeter chicken joint, Eat the Bird, begin today’s competition with owner Dan and head chef Luke risking it all with their fried chicken fayre.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Prepare for pure decadence! Kirsten stuns with showstopping choux buns, nut-filled caramel wheels, and citrus-infused chocolate crackles. Along the way, she reveals her top tips and tricks for mastering chocolate like a pro.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey head to Seoul, home to one of the most popular and on trend cuisines in the world. - After meeting the Kiwi Ambassador, Karena and Kasey are taken out to try traditional Korean BBQ and a sing along with a Korean, Kiwi twist. - The sisters then split up—one heads to the hills and has a lesson with a kimchi Master, while the other eats her way around the famous Gwangjang Market. - At the end of the week they showcase Kiwi-Korean fusion cuisine to an elite group of foodies.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey are in the beautiful city of Rome and are on a learning curve about how to eat like a Roman. From Pasta Masters to finding out all about making traditional Italian dishes to being hand fed tripe, Rome is a city of discovery. - But it’s not all about the food as they head to Monte Cassino to visit the graves and battle-grounds where their whakapapa fought, as well as pay respect to where hundreds of other Kiwis lost their lives. - At the end of the week Karena and Kasey are tasked with cooking a three-course dinner for the Ambassador and a group of VIP guests, but have they bitten of more than they can chew?

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley pays culinary homage to the dishes that our mums used to make. Ainsley puts a spin on one if his mum’s classic recipes—Brown Chicken Stew & Rice N’ Peas—and country duo The Shires take over his kitchen with an exclusive jam session…and treat Ainsley to a Midnight Pasta feast! - Baking queen Juliet Sear shares her mum’s secret recipe for a sumptuous quiche; Ainsley knocks up some quick homemade garlic bread; and then rounds things off with one of his childhood favourites—Coconut & Lime Fairy Cakes.

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson shares her three favourite recipes for no-bake treats. These are the perfect treats to whip up when you don’t want to turn the oven on.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Cattle are an important part of the grasslands' ecosystem. Jenn meets with two ranchers and a chef as she follows this nutrient-dense ingredient from the pasture to the plate.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today’s Come Dine With Me: The Professionals comes from Essex and kicking off the competition is chef and owner Billy and his manager Sam, who are confident their original vegan BBQ menu will bag them the grand.

programme.title: Hot Mess Express
programme.sub-title: Hot Mess Alex and pro-chef Dylan
programme.desc: Alex, who can throw a party but can’t cook, will try to make a bacon cheese burger with grilled cheese buns. He has 45 minutes and Chef Dylan whispering in his ear. Will he make it in time?
